questions.question_text: Which protocol sends authentication and accounting in different requests?

discussion.content:
TACACS+ uses the AAA architecture, which separates AAA. This allows separate authentication solutions that can still use TACACS+ for authorization and accounting. For example, with TACACS+, it is possible to use Kerberos authentication and TACACS+ authorization and accounting. After a NAS authenticates on a Kerberos server, it requests authorization information from a TACACS+ server without having to re-authenticate. The NAS informs the TACACS+ server that it has successfully authenticated on a Kerberos server, and the server then provides authorization information.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/security-vpn/remote-authentication-dial-user-service-radius/13838-10.html#comp_traffic

Doesn't RADIUS also send authentication & accounting in different requests?
I know it sends authentication and authorization in the same request.

questions.question_text: Which feature of Cisco ASA allows VPN users to be postured against Cisco ISE without requiring an inline posture node?

discussion.content:
The Cisco ASA Version 9.2.1 supports RADIUS Change of Authorization (CoA) (RFC 5176). This allows for posturing of VPN users against the Cisco ISE without the need for an IPN. After a VPN user logs in, the ASA redirects web traffic to the ISE, where the user is provisioned with a Network Admission Control (NAC) Agent or Web Agent. The agent performs specific checks on the user machine in order to determine its compliance against a configured set of posture rules, such as Operating System (OS), patches, AntiVirus, Service, Application, or Registry rules.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/security/adaptive-security-appliance-asa-software/117693-configure-ASA-00.html

choices.B: It provides the My Devices portal, allowing users to add devices to the network.
choices.A: It provides support for native supplicants, allowing users to connect devices directly to the network.
choices.C: It provides support for users to install the Cisco NAC agent on enterprise devices.
choices.D: It provides self-registration functionality to allow guest users to access the network.

questions.question_text: Which functionality does the Cisco ISE self-provisioning flow provide?

discussion.content:
Self-Provisioning Portal

Employees access the Self-Provisioning portal when registering personal devices using native supplicants. The first time employees attempt to access the network using a personal device, they will be guided automatically through registering and installing the supplicant. After they have registered a device, they can use the My Devices portal to manage it. 

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/ise/1-2/user_guide/ise_user_guide/ise_mydevices.html

SGACL Policies
Policy enforcement within the Cisco TrustSec domain is represented by a permissions matrix, each cell in the body of the matrix can contain an ordered list of SGACLs which specifies what should be applied to packets originating from the source security group and destined for the destination security group.

questions.question_text: What is the function of the SGACL policy matrix on a Cisco TrustSec domain with SGT Assignment?

choices.E: It lists all hosts that are permitted to participate in the TrustSec domain.
choices.D: It lists all servers that are permitted to participate in the TrustSec domain.
choices.A: It determines which access policy to apply to the endpoint.
choices.C: It determines the path the SGT of the packet takes when entering the Cisco TrustSec domain.
choices.B: It determines which switches are trusted within the TrustSec domain.

questions.question_text: Which three host modes support MACsec? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
MACsec, MKA and 802.1x Host Modes
You can use MACsec and the MKA Protocol with 802.1x single-host mode, multiple-host mode, or Multi Domain Authentication (MDA) mode. Multiple authentication mode is not supported.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/lan/catalyst3750x_3560x/software/release/15-0_1_se/configuration/guide/3750xcg/swmacsec.html
